comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Rebecca Edelsohn (b. c1890) was a hunger striker and anarchist, and at one time a companion of Alexander Berkman's: userwww.sfsu.edu/~jmmoran/edelsohn.htm

comment.author: 70251312@N00

comment._content: Full size versions of the Becky Edelson pictures from the Bain Collection are now on Wikimedia Commons: commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Category:Becky_Edelson

comment.author: 33593953@N02
comment._content: Thanks so much for connecting up the pictures, the people, and the event through the sources you cite.  I found it interesting to reflect on this event and its links to labor history (Edelsohn and company apparently were jailed for denouncing John D. Rockefeller, Jr., and the violence in Ludlow, Colorado, during the coal strike), especially as we're commemorating today the 100th anniversary of another landmark in the annals of American labor: the Triangle Shirtwaist Fire.  We'll add information to the descriptions when we next update.
